fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models

Class AtomicModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, AtomicModelI, EventsExchangingI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicES_Model, AtomicHIOA, BasicCounterModel, ClientGenerator, ControllerModel, DependentCounterModel, ServerModel, TicModel, TicModel

    public abstract class AtomicModel
extends Model
implements AtomicModelI
    The class AtomicModel implements the most general methods and instance variables for DEVS atomic models.

    Description

    The implementation provided here follows the spirit of the description appearing in:

    H. Vangheluwe, Discrete Event System Specification (DEVS) formalism, courseware, 2001.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       importedEventTypes != null
 invariant       exportedEventTypes != null

    Black-box Invariants

    TODO: check imported/exported events with annotations 
     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2016-01-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      AtomicModel(java.lang.String uri, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit, AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
      create an atomic simulation model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AtomicModel

        public AtomicModel(java.lang.String uri,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                   AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
        create an atomic simulation model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.

      • isCoordinated

        public boolean isCoordinated()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return true if the simulation engine is coordinated by a parent.

        Description

        In DEVS, simulation can operate in different mode. The traditional mode confers to the coupled models and their coordination engine the role to pilot the advance of their submodels keeping a global synchronisation between the simulation clocks of their submodels. In real time, atomic models and their simulation engine operate on their own without being coordinated by parent coupled models and their coordination engines.

        This method allows to know when a model is coordinated and when it is not.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        isCoordinated in interface ModelI
        Returns:
        true if the simulation engine is coordinated by a parent.
        See Also:
        ModelI.isCoordinated()

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        initialiseState in class Model
        Parameters:
        initialTime - time of the simulation when it will start.
        See Also:
        Model.initialiseState(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • internalTransition

        public void internalTransition()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform the next internal transition, both calling the method userDefinedInternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.

        Description

        In the standard DEVS protocol, this method is assumed to be defined by users in their atomic models. However, having only one method to do so makes it difficult to include common behaviours for models. Moreover, DEVS allows to define new types of models where specific common behaviours must be implemented. With the traditional DEVS vision, this would end up asking the users to cater for these common behaviours in each of their implementations the method, an error-prone burden put on their shoulders. In this library, we prefer to split transitions in two parts:

        • a library defined part, here internalTransition, which implementations in abstract classes include their common behaviours and, for atomic models, calls the user model specific part;
        • a user model-specific part, here userDefinedInternalTransition, which implements the execution internal events of the user-defined models per se.

        After the execution of the method, the relationships between timeAdvance, getTimeOfNextEvent, getNextTimeAdvance and getCurrentStateTime() is restored to reflect the wait for the next internal event.

        Contract

         pre     getTimeOfNextEvent().lessThan(Time.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post    getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()).equals(getNextTimeAdvance())
        Specified by:
        internalTransition in interface ModelI
        See Also:
        ModelI.internalTransition()

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        ModelI.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • externalTransition

        public void externalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do the next external transition, both calling the method userDefinedExternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.

        Description

        In the standard DEVS protocol, this method is assumed to be defined by users in their atomic models. However, having only one method to do so makes it difficult to include common behaviours for models. Moreover, DEVS allows to define new types of models where specific common behaviours must be implemented. With the traditional DEVS vision, this would end up asking the users to cater for these common behaviours in each of their implementations the method, an error-prone burden put on their shoulders. In this library, we prefer to split transitions in two parts:

        • a library defined part, here externalTransition, which implementations in abstract classes include their common behaviours and, for atomic models, calls the user model specific part;
        • a user model-specific part, here userDefinedExternalTransition, which implements the execution internal events of the user-defined models per se.

        After the execution of the method, the relationships between timeAdvance, getTimeOfNextEvent(), getNextTimeAdvance and getCurrentStateTime() is restored to reflect the wait for the next internal event.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().lessThanOrEqual(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post    getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()).equals(getNextTimeAdvance())
        Specified by:
        externalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - elapsed time since the last transition.
        See Also:
        ModelI.externalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().lessThanOrEqual(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - simulation time since the last processed event.
        See Also:
        ModelI.userDefinedExternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • produceOutput

        public void produceOutput(Time current)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        Description

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing by their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        produceOutput in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
        See Also:
        ModelI.produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • storeInput

        public void storeInput(java.lang.String destinationURI,
                       java.util.ArrayList<EventI> es)
        Description copied from interface: EventsExchangingI
        store external events imported from another simulation model.

        Description

        The DEVS protocol proposes two ways to propagate events among models. The first way is to return the produced events to the parent coordination engine which passes them to a sibling or return them to its own parent coordination engine.

        Contract

         pre     destinationURI != null && !destinationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     getURI().equals(destinationURI)
 pre     es != null && !es.isEmpty()
 pre     es.stream().allMatch(e -> isImportedEventType(e.getClass())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        storeInput in interface EventsExchangingI
        Parameters:
        destinationURI - URI of the destination model.
        es - imported external events to be stored.
        See Also:
        EventsExchangingI.storeInput(java.lang.String, java.util.ArrayList)

      • showCurrentState

        public void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent,
                             Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI

      • modelContentAsString

        protected void modelContentAsString(java.lang.String indent,
                                    java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        produce a string representation the model content with the given indentation (perhaps with several lines) in the given string buffer.

        Contract

         pre     indent != null && sb != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Overrides:
        modelContentAsString in class Model
        Parameters:
        indent - indentation to be used when producing a new line.
        sb - string buffer to which the content must be added.
